Title: Service Now Developer
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Service Now Developer for a project based in Porto (Hybrid regime - twice a week at the office).


Responsabilities:

  • Ensure the development of new functionalities for specific projects;
  • Manage maintenance actions of the instances;
  • Manage and guarantee instance settings;
  • Keep the instances in operational condition;
  • Provide user support.


Requirements:

  • Nice to have ServiceNow experience (but training on the software is planned);
  • Nice to have Javascript knowledge;
  • Nice to have REST API knowledge;
  • Nice to have Web languages (HTML, CSS, Angular JS);
  • Good level of English - minimum B2 (mandatory)/Good level of French is a nice to have;
  • The candidate must be living in Portugal (mandatory).


If you‚Äôre interested in this job please send your CV in English.


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: QAE | Robot Framework @Porto
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!

Type of position: HYBRID (at Porto)




The amazing you, will have:

4+ years of professional experience with Automated Tests, mainly using Robot Framework;
Tools for service testing: Postman, Insomnia, SoupUI, Bruno etc...
Advanced English is required;

Knowledge in Continuous Integration (Pipelines and code versioning);
Experience working with DevOps;
Programming logic;
Gherkin's knowledge;
Knowledge in Xray or some Jira plugin like ‚ÄúZphyr‚Äù;
Docker(Containers);
Working with agile methodologies and practices: Scrum, Kanban, small teams, strong communication and constant interaction.







To turn yourself from amazing to unique, you¬¥ll have (plus):

Related certifications.




Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity

Title: Junior Automation Programmer
Description:
We are a global digital business services organization with a mission to improve the way people and companies work. Forever. Our Consulting, Technology and Learning teams design and deliver transformational digital products and experiences that add value to our clients‚Äô businesses and to their customers‚Äô lives.




Every day, across the world, our teams are pioneering faster, better ways to bring our client‚Äôs most exciting ideas to life.




Are you passionate about innovation? Are you familiar with Mendix and Azure ecosystem? Are you eager to be part of a team shaping the future of intelligent automation? We are looking for a Junior Automation Programmer to join our team!




We want you to:

Design Mendix apps and integrate data.
Execute corrective and preventive maintenance.
Optimize performance and stay updated on vendor trends.
Support established practices and standards for the team to reach its goals.




This job might be for you if you:

1+ year of experience as a Mendix Developer.
Professional experience with cloud platforms (AWS/Azure).
Experience with object-oriented languages, such as JavaScript and Java.
Intermediate Mendix certification (not obligatory).
Understand the principles and practices required to ensure software delivery excellence and implement them to ensure quality. This includes estimates and work breakdown, risk mitigation code standards and defect root cause analysis.




What we offer:

A comprehensive health and life insurance
A flexible work environment: you can work remotely or hybrid from one of our locations
Working with the latest tools (Mac or Windows) and technologies on meaningful client engagements
Career growth opportunities and a clear progression framework
Educational programs and opportunities of training and certification at the expense of the company
Local teambuilding activities and get-togethers
Generous referral bonus program, quarterly and yearly company awards with financial incentives
8 hours of paid volunteering
Meal allowance
23 vacation days yearly




The best part

Emergn is a global digital business services firm with a mission to improve the way people and companies work. Forever. We partner with some of the world‚Äôs most respected businesses, including Fortune 500, FTSE 100, and Global 2000 companies, to turn their most promising ideas into valuable digital products and customer experiences faster.




Our experts work with clients to transform their business in three ways:

Helping to better define their thinking, including shaping their product organization and clarifying and communicating their product strategy.
Developing their people by delivering exemplary training in product management, modern ways of working, and leadership.
Delivering their outcomes by building customer-centric products and customer experiences.




Emergn‚Äôs unique approach, Value, Flow, Quality (VFQ), combines the best of Agile, Lean, design thinking, and systems thinking to turn investments in new ways of working into tangible results. With a strong presence in over a dozen countries and headquarters in Boston (US) and London (EMEA), we‚Äôre making an impact every day.




Ready to make an impact?




Join us today!

Title: Sensor Software Engineer
Description:
Do you want to make a change for the better in the world?

Vestas Technology & Operations > Research & Development > Advanced Sensing & Diagnostics

The Advanced Sensing and Diagnostics Sub Module is part of the Turbine Control Software Module within Vestas Power Solutions. As such, we are responsible for delivering the software for the most complex sensor solutions, e.g. Wind Sensing, Tower Accelerations and Blade Load Sensing. Furthermore, our mission is to create smart sensor signals, which enables the turbine to run more reliable, more efficiently or enables us to detect current and potential future defects to improve our service business and thus creates value for Vestas and our customers.

For you, this is the ideal environment to apply your software engineering skills in a highly diverse team, encourage a culture of innovation to unlock customer value and ensure the highest team efficiency.

Responsibilities


Ensure project deliveries for our technical and turbine projects as part of an agile team
Be responsible to guide one or more of our key results to ensure high team efficiency and best practices
Conduct root cause analysis to pinpoint potential turbine performance issues
Contribute to defining functional and non-functional software requirements for turbine control systems
Develop innovative algorithms for smart sensing and diagnostics solutions
Participate in the refinement and advancement of processes, software, and tools


Qualifications


Master in Software Engineering, Control Engineering, Electrical Engineering or similar background
3 years experience in embedded software & data analytics environment
Experience with C++, Matlab / Simulink
Good skills within physics and data analytics, which enables you to understand turbine physics easily and analyze large sets of data efficiently


Competencies


Highly accountable and self-driven
Acts as a role model for the team
Upholds high standards of quality without compromise
Embraces change and proactively in takes improvement ideas or problems and implements their solutions
Very good communication skills for external and internal stakeholder management
Ability to effectively reach out to stakeholders within and outside the company


What We Offer

Within VSP we are one of the most cross functional departments with a huge potential to create customer Value, we are on an exciting journey of getting our processes, tools, requirements to the highest standards. You can not only be part of this, but be part of a team which mission it is to improve how the turbines function.

Additional Information

We look forward to receiving your application as soon as possible, as we will be reviewing applications on a rolling basis. To apply for this opportunity please submit your resume in English.

BEWARE ‚Äì RECRUITMENT FRAUD

It has come to our attention that there are a number of fraudulent emails from people pretending to work for Vestas. Read more via this link, https://www.vestas.com/en/careers/our-recruitment-process

DEIB Statement

At Vestas, we recognize the value of diversity, equity, and inclusion in driving innovation and success. We strongly encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply, particularly those who may hesitate due to their identity or feel they do not meet every criterion. As our CEO states, "Expertise and talent come in many forms, and a diverse workforce enhances our ability to think differently and solve the complex challenges of our industry". Your unique perspective is what will help us powering the solution for a sustainable, green energy future.

About Vestas

Vestas is the energy industry‚Äôs global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore.

Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 185 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, we have an unmatched track record demonstrating our expertise within the field.

With 30,000 employees globally, we are a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution ‚Äì today, tomorrow, and far into the future.

Vestas promotes a diverse workforce which embraces all social identities and is free of any discrimination. We commit to create and sustain an environment that acknowledges and harvests different experiences, skills, and perspectives. We also aim to give everyone equal access to opportunity.

To learn more about our company and life at Vestas, we invite you to visit our website at www.vestas.com and follow us on our social media channels. We also encourage you to join our Talent Universe to receive notifications on new and relevant postings.

We strongly encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply, particularly those who may hesitate due to their identity or feel they do not meet every criterion. As our CEO states, "Expertise and talent come in many forms, and a diverse workforce enhances our ability to think differently and solve the complex challenges of our industry". Your unique perspective is what will help us powering the solution for a sustainable, green energy future.

About Vestas

Vestas is the energy industry‚Äôs global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore.

Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 185 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, we have an unmatched track record demonstrating our expertise within the field.

With 30,000 employees globally, we are a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution ‚Äì today, tomorrow, and far into the future.

Vestas promotes a diverse workforce which embraces all social identities and is free of any discrimination. We commit to create and sustain an environment that acknowledges and harvests different experiences, skills, and perspectives. We also aim to give everyone equal access to opportunity.

To learn more about our company and life at Vestas, we invite you to visit our website at www.vestas.com and follow us on our social media channels. We also encourage you to join our Talent Universe to receive notifications on new and relevant postings.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Who are we?

Mantu is an independent international consulting player, founded in 2007. Bringing together expert and complementary brands, Mantu stands out for the breadth of its spectrum, responding to all business transformation challenges.




Its activities are divided into four practices:

Leadership & Advocacy, Technology, Digital Marketing & Experience, Total Talent Management.




A wide range of skills, all serving a single mission: connecting and powering companies with leading teams and technology to succeed faster and sustainably.




From its headquarters in Geneva, Switzerland, Mantu relies on a community of 11,500 talented people in more than 60 countries on 5 continents and has a turnover of 1billion euros.

Job description




As a Senior Data Scientist, you will be immersed in a dynamic environment where you will work on real-world problems, contribute to ongoing projects, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. This position is designed to offer hands-on experience and a deep understanding of the cutting-edge technologies that drive our solutions.




Key Responsibilities:

Contribute to the development and refinement of machine learning models.
Contribute to build and deployment pipelines.
Perform statistical analysis and data processing using Python and related technologies.
Participate in the collection, cleaning, and preprocessing of large datasets.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business challenges and provide data-driven insights.
Contribute to the improvement of our AI algorithms and systems.
Document and present findings and recommendations to stakeholders.
Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in data science and AI research.




Profile Requirement

Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Deep understanding of machine learning concepts and algorithms.
Proficiency in Python.
Proficiency in data manipulation and visualization tools, such as pandas, numpy, seaborn, matplotlib, and others.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
Eagerness to take on challenging tasks.
Required: Python, OpenAI, HuggingFace, Pytorch and/or TensorFlow, Flask and/or FastAPI, Docker, SQL and NoSQL, proficiency in CI/CD
Mastery of Generative AI such as ChatGPT is a plus for improving day to day activity.




‚ÄúMantu is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability or other characteristics.‚Äù

Title: Process Mining Data Science Trainee (f/m/div)
Description:
Are you a communicative and proactive team player who wants to thrive in an international and diverse team? Do you have a passion for innovation, data engineering, and process mining? Are you eager to develop your skills in this field while having access to a wide range of courses and trainings? Then, this position is ideal for you! Join our Corporate Process Team and start an incredible journey at Infineon Porto!

Job Description

As Process Mining Trainee, you will embark on an exciting journey. You will have the opportunity to develop technical and functional knowledge in several areas while interacting with our teams in Singapore and Germany.

In your new role, you will:


Build and maintain data models and data visualizations for process mining
Support and consult users using process mining
Create technical documentation
Support process mining community and outreach activities


You have good communication skills and a unique team spirit mindset. With a proactive and structured working attitude, you are willing to learn and grow, especially in multicultural contexts.You are best equipped for this position if you have:


A degree in Software Engineering, IT Administration, or Data Engineering
Data manipulation skills for at least one well-known database system, like Oracle or MS SQL (T-SQL, stored procedures, DBT ‚Äì Data Build Tool)
Experience in at least one programming language is a plus
Knowledge of ETL tools, methods, and/or middleware (e.g., MS SSIS) would be an advantage
Fluency in English


Contact:

B√°rbara Moreira , LinkedIn

#WeAreIn for driving decarbonization and digitalization.

As a global leader in semiconductor solutions in power systems and IoT, Infineon enables game-changing solutions for green and efficient energy, clean and safe mobility, as well as smart and secure IoT. Together, we drive innovation and customer success, while caring for our people and empowering them to reach ambitious goals. Be a part of making life easier, safer and greener.

Are you in?


Welcome to Infineon Technologies Business Solutions in Porto! - Infineon Technologies Business Solutions is a vibrant global hub, driven by diverse talents and an operational culture of excellence, in a privileged geographic location. The team of more than 25 nationalities works together in a dynamic, diverse and inclusive environment. We lead innovation and digital transformation, shaping the future of Infineon Technologies. At the heart of everything we do, people matter most. Our ultimate goal is to craft a unique experience for both our customers and employees.


At our site you will find a range of diverse teams that have built a reputation for delivering high-quality services for all Infineon in Finance, Procurement, Human Resources, IT, Audit, Legal, Compliance, Business Continuity and Sustainability, Cyber Security, Communication, Corporate Supply Chain Logistics and Sales & Marketing. Porto is a powerhouse of ideas and solutions, a key player in the global company‚Äôs puzzle, delivering specialized services and innovative solutions.

Together, Infineon Technologies Business Solutions will continue to shape the future, driving innovation and excellence for years to come.

We are on a journey to create the best Infineon for everyone.

This means we embrace diversity and inclusion and welcome everyone for who they are. At Infineon, we offer a working environment characterized by trust, openness, respect and tolerance and are committed to give all applicants and employees equal opportunities. We base our recruiting decisions on the applicant¬¥s experience and skills.

We look forward to receiving your resume, even if you do not entirely meet all the requirements of the job posting.

Please let your recruiter know if they need to pay special attention to something in order to enable your participation in the interview process.

Click here for more information about Diversity & Inclusion at Infineon.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Scientist
Description:
ABOUT US üöÄ

Hostelworld Group, the global hostel-focussed online booking platform, inspires adventurous minds to meet the world and come back with life-changing stories to tell. Our customers are not your average tourists, they crave cultural connection and unique experiences that we make possible by providing an unbeatable selection of hostels in unmissable locations ‚Äì all in the palm of their hand.

It is the social nature and community feel of hostels and their environment, that enable travellers to embrace journeys of discovery, adventure and meaning. We have more than 13 million reviews across 17,800 hostels in more than 179 countries, making the brand the leading online hub for social travel. The website operates in 19 different languages and our mobile app in 13 languages.

Founded in 1999 and headquartered in Dublin, Hostelworld has a growing, high-calibre team of 230 people within Technology, Product, Global Markets, HR, Finance & Legal and Marketing Teams across our Dublin, London, Porto, Shanghai and Sydney offices. Hostelworld is listed on the London Stock Exchange and Dublin Euronext. You can read more about our story here.




LOCATIONüåç

This role is based in Portugal. We have an office hub in Porto available for those who prefer a hybrid model where you can spend time with colleagues in-person. You will need to be able to commute to our office hub as required from time to time.




THE ROLE & TEAMüë®üèΩ‚Äçü§ù‚Äçüë®üèº

During 2020, Hostelworld pivoted from a more traditional functional CMO/CPO/CTO organisation to a ‚Äòfull ownership‚Äù growth team plus platform team model. More specifically, we established four growth teams to cover all consumer /hostel facing Apps and channels that reported into the CPO; and a separate CTO organisation that became responsible for supplying and maintaining common core services (such as inventory pricing, availability and checkout) via APIs to these four growth teams. Each of these four growth teams comprise resources that report into the CPO and dedicated resources drawn from the engineering function (developers, QA resources) and analytics function. Collectively, these four growth teams comprise ~ 50 headcount and are wholly accountable for their KPIs and roadmaps




We currently have four growth teams and four further central/support teams as follows;

Paid performance team : responsible for growing and optimising our paid web channels, including (web) landing page optimisation
Core team : responsible for our progressive web app (PWA Website), our organic web channels such as SEO, and more generally our core OTA funnel performance
Mobile/Social team : responsible for our iOS and Android Apps, including paid and organic downloads, CRM strategy and more generally our social network and event management (LinkUps) platforms
Supply team : responsible for all our hostel facing platforms and tools, supporting our two sided marketplace through collaboration with our customer facing teams and leading on our inventory, availability and rates position
Product Design (Central) team : responsible for defining and implementing a uniform User Interface/Experience design language across our consumer and supplier facing Apps, consistent with our Mission and Brand
Content and Creative (Central) team : responsible for defining and leading the creative direction for Hostelworld, delivering content primarily through the four Growth teams above but also supporting the wider business needs with copywriting, content writing, graphic design and video production assets
Product and Technology Operations (Central) team : primarily responsible for driving alignment and coordination across the Growth and Technology teams quarterly roadmap planning process; and managing vendor spend across these two teams which accounts for the vast majority of non Wages and Salaries expenditure across the company
Customer Service (Support) team : responsible for handling all consumer support queries, mostly via webform/chat and email across 19 languages.




WHAT YOU'LL DO üë©‚Äçüíª

Stakeholder Collaboration:

Partner with business leaders to identify opportunities for leveraging data science to solve business problems
Work closely with product teams to define requirements and roadmaps and with engineering to implement algorithms and ETLs.
Coordinate with stakeholders and provide timely delivery

Technical Expertise:

Work closely with a team of machine learning engineers, data engineers and other data scientists to develop best in class search and ranking algorithms

Performance and Impact:

Monitor data product performance and business impact and act accordingly when objectives are not met
Develop comprehensive diagnostic approaches, a/b testing plans and scalable, repeatable best practices for our data science product development and roll out processes




WHAT WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FOR üëÄ

MSc or PhD in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or related field with a preference for a specialization in machine learning or data science
5+ years‚Äô experience as a machine learning data scientist in a digital product environment, ideally ecommerce or two sided marketplace, developing & deploying successful ranking and recommendation algorithms in the Cloud
Expertise across all machine learning workstreams: using large data sets, model development, feature engineering, statistics, experimentation, data visualization, optimization, software development
Mastery of experimental design, advanced A/B testing techniques, evaluation metrics for ML models
Understanding of MLOps, model productionalization and experience in implementing machine learning algorithms end to end
Very strong programming skills in languages such as Python and machine learning libraries (such as NumPy, Pandas, Hugging Face), deep learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch), and big data query languages (Scala, Spark)
Experience with LLMs as productivity tools
Experience mentoring more junior data scientists and knowledge sharing across their organization
Expertise in conducting exploratory data analysis to understand user search behaviour, data distributions, trends, and potential challenges.
Experience with cloud frameworks like VertexAI.




WHAT WE OFFER üíØ

Competitive salary & benefits
Enhanced annual leave plus 3 Wellbeing Days per year
Paid family leave (maternity, paternity, surrogacy & adoption)
Agile working (plus a Working from Abroad Policy!)
Support for your ongoing growth & development
Inclusive people policies (sickness, menopause, compassionate and fertility leave)
A chance to give back to your local community with 5 paid volunteering days




We believe in talented and diverse teams that reflect the diversity of our customers and the communities in which we operate. Everyone brings different perspectives and experiences. We lay out the above requirements to guide applicants to the experiences that we believe will allow you to be successful in the role. If you don‚Äôt meet them all, please consider applying if you think you can still perform the role as described.

  • Expertise across all machine learning workstreams: using large data sets, model development, feature engineering, statistics, experimentation, data visualization, optimization, software development
  • Mastery of experimental design, advanced A/B testing techniques, evaluation metrics for ML models
  • Understanding of MLOps, model productionalization and experience in implementing machine learning algorithms end to end
  • Very strong programming skills in languages such as Python and machine learning libraries (such as NumPy, Pandas, Hugging Face), deep learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch), and big data query languages (Scala, Spark)

  • Competitive salary & benefits

Title: Software Engineer - Python - Container Images
Description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1100+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution. The company is founder led, profitable and growing.

Canonical is building a new generation of Ubuntu-based container images to simplify open-source application deployment across the world. These container images will be free to use with long-term security commitments, and engineered for performance, security and usability. As with Ubuntu, we will work in the open and welcome community participation.

In this role, you'll be developing the tools and technology for building and maintaining this new generation of container images. You'll be working with multiple teams, both inside and outside Canonical, to ensure we deliver container images with the highest quality whilst maintaining a seamless Ubuntu user experience. You will also be highly involved in the implementation and maintenance of the Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery automation around these container images, for which you are expected to demonstrate deep insights into container-based DevOps.

You will be contributing to fast-moving products like Rocks (OCI images) and Chisel, and thus have the chance to help steer and consolidate this new team. You'll gain experience with numerous container technologies and participate in exciting and exploratory tasks, where your feedback will be critical for the decision-making process. As an engineer, your seniority will be based on your software development background and ability to lead junior team members.

Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical. This is an exciting opportunity for experienced software engineers looking for a place to leave their mark, who are passionate about shaping an open source product with the highest quality, with and for the community!


Location**: EMEA


This role entails


Build robust, scalable, leading-edge container images
Work on automated Ci/CD processes for building, testing and publishing our container images
Write tools and tests for assessing security compliance and cloud-native compatibility
Work in Python to deliver new functionalities to our container-building tools
Participate in strong engineering process through code and architectural review
Provide technical feedback for the team's decision-making process
Engage with the open-source community as a subject-matter expert
Grow our knowledge base and write documentation
Work in a collaborative, agile and globally distributed environment
Mentor and help hiring
Work from home with global travel up to 15% for internal and external events


What we are looking for in you


You are knowledgeable and passionate about software development
You are a team player and have experience in collaborative development
You have worked with CI/CD systems (e.g. Jenkins, GitHub Actions, Concourse CI, etc.)
You have a track record of delivering timely, high-quality software
You have experience with container images and containerised operations
You master at least one container management/orchestration tool (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, etc.)
You have significant experience with Python
You are experienced with Linux systems administration and package management
You have strong written and verbal communication skills to convey technical concepts
You bring clarity to technical and engineering discussions
You are someone who strongly believes that sharing is caring, and knowledge is power
Your skills range from those of a Graduate to a mid-senior Software Engineer
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or a similar degree


What we offer you

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.


Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Maternity and paternity leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Marketing Decision Scientist
Description:
ABOUT US üöÄ

Hostelworld Group PLC is a ground-breaking social network powered OTA focused on the hostel market, with a clear mission to help travellers find people to hang out with.

Founded in 1999, we‚Äôre a well-known trusted brand with 240 teammates across 11 countries; hostel partners in 180 countries; and a strong commitment to building a better world in all that we do.




LOCATIONüåç

This role is based in Portugal. We have a co-working space in Porto for those who prefer a hybrid model where you can spend time with colleagues in-person. If necessary, the role can be remote within Portugal with coming together for team meetings as needed.




WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH üë®üèΩ‚Äçü§ù‚Äçüë®üèº

You will play a key role in a diverse, highly-talented Analytics & Insights team providing insights across a number of growth units including paid marketing, customer analytics and app analytics to support decision making at C and senior management level. The Marketing Decision Scientist will play a pivotal role in driving data-informed marketing strategies and decisions, with a particular emphasis on managing and optimising Google Ads bidding algorithms. As a key member of the Analytics and Insights team, this role will involve close collaboration with paid marketing, app marketing, and data teams to uncover insights, optimise campaigns, and contribute to business growth.




WHAT YOU'LL DO üë©‚Äçüíª

You will hone and develop a wide range of technical skills in managing our data analytics and data science products. The paid analytics team require a person who is flexible, adaptable and able to translate business needs into measurable results. It‚Äôs a rewarding experience with exciting diverse work:

Develop, manage, and optimise bidding algorithms for Google Ads campaigns (Google search results and Google Hotel Price Ads) using Python scripts.
Translate business objectives into functional code, ensuring that the bidding logic aligns with marketing goals and maximises the return on advertising spend (ROAS).
Optimise budget allocation across channels and campaigns to improve profitability.
Continuously monitor and analyse performance of the campaigns, identify areas of inefficiency, and develop strategies to enhance bidding logic.
Provide data-driven recommendations for optimising marketing spend, customer acquisition, retention, and lifetime value.
Design, implement, and analyse A/B tests and other experimental methodologies to assess the impact of marketing initiatives.
Serve as a subject matter expert on data science best practices within the Analytics & Insights team.




WHAT WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FOR üëÄ

Experience & Qualifications:

Minimum 2 years of experience in a Data Analytics or Data Science role, preferably within a marketing department.
Advanced skills in SQL, Python, R, or similar programming languages.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Communicate clearly and with purpose, working effectively with team members and stakeholders across the organisation.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.

Essential Skills:

Competency in Python/R.
SQL (preferably BigQuery, Snowflake).
Strong proficiency in statistical analysis, machine learning, and predictive modelling techniques.

Desirable Skills:

Understanding of digital marketing metrics, SEO, SEM, and customer journey analysis.
Experience with data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Looker, Power BI, or similar platforms.
Familiarity with orchestration and ETL/ELT tools (e.g., Apache Airflow, dbt) is a plus.
Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git).




WHAT WE OFFER üíØ

Competitive salary & benefits
Enhanced annual leave plus 3 Wellbeing Days per year
Paid family leave (maternity, paternity, surrogacy & adoption)
Agile working (plus a Working from Abroad Policy!)
Support for your ongoing growth & development
Inclusive people policies (sickness, menopause, compassionate and fertility leave)
A chance to give back to your local community with 5 paid volunteering days




Our people are key to our success. Our talented and diverse teams reflect the diversity of our customers and the communities in which we operate. Everyone brings different perspectives and experiences; you don‚Äôt have to meet all the requirements listed above to apply for this role.

Title: QAE
Description:
Prime IT is a 100% Portuguese company, specialized in the IT and Telecommunications sector. We work with the best national and international talent, and we guarantee the most appropriate solutions for the projects we develop.

We have over 2350 collaborators in the development of national and international projects. Our teams are specialized in Consulting, Nearshore, Project Management and Closed Projects, and our success is a reflection of the results we achieve daily.




We believe that the path to success is to do what makes us happy.




PORTUGAL | SPAIN | FRANCE | SWITZERLAND | UK | POLAND | BRASIL | VIETNAM




Main Technical Requirements:

‚úÖ Higher Education in Engineering or Information Technologies.

‚úÖ 5 years of experience minimum as a QA Engineer.

‚úÖ Experience with manual and automated testing.

‚úÖ Expertise testing REST APIs and frontend.

‚úÖ Proficiency on testing frameworks like Selenium, Cypress and Playwright.

‚úÖ Experience in BDD (Behavior Driven Development) frameworks e.g. Cucumber.

‚úÖ Experience in test management (Xray) and reporting bugs.

‚úÖ Experience with API tools (Postman and Swagger).

‚úÖ Experience integrating test tools with automated CI/CD pipelines on Azure DevOps.

‚úÖ Knowledge of SQL and experience with SQL Server.

‚úÖ Experience with Jira/Confluence.




Other Requirements:

‚úÖ Fluency in English (minimum B2 ‚Äì mandatory).

‚úÖ Fluency in Portuguese (minimum C1 ‚Äì mandatory).

‚úÖ Good communication skills.

‚úÖ Great team player.

‚úÖ Self-directed learner, proactive and self-sufficient, with strong organizational, time management and problem-solving skills, able to work with minor guidance







Apply or send your CV to djesus@primeit.pt and join our Prime Team!

www.primeit.pt

Title: Banking Sector | Python Developer (Hybrid)
HTML:
Company Description

At Devoteam, we believe that technology with strong human values can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People unlocks the future, creating a positive impact on the people and the world around us. We are a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA, with a revenue of ‚Ç¨1B. We believe in transforming technology to create value for our clients, partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people. We are proud of the culture we have built together. We are proud of our people at the service of technology. We are proud of our diverse environment. Because we are #TechforPeople. Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 20 EMEA countries. Become one of our +10.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security. Let‚Äôs fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.


Job Description

  • Develop code as per the team‚Äôs specifications ‚Äì analyze, validate and review code;

  • Participate in coding sprints and continuous improvement;

  • Automation of security rules implementation;

  • Document the tool and operating mode, troubleshooting, etc.;

  • Perform tests.


Qualifications
  • 3+ years of experience with of Django framework;

  • Experience in frontend development (Angular) is a plus;

  • Experienced in Agile methodology;

  • Experience using SDLC tools ‚Äì software orchestration / versioning tools, automation server, etc;

  • Good organizational, analytical and problem-solving skills;

  • Autonomous, while capable of working within a team;

  • Fluency in English.


Additional Information

The Devoteam Group works for equal opportunities, promoting its employees based on merit and actively fights against all forms of discrimination. We are convinced that diversity contributes to the creativity, dynamism and excellence of our organization. All of our vacancies are open to people with disabilities.

Who Are We

We are META, not just a company but a TEAM that will revolutionize how you see tech recruitment. Based in √âvora but working remotely, we partner with national and international organizations, with offices spread across Portugal.

We are a disruptive force, constantly charging towards big opportunities for the best professionals. Our Human 2 Human approach is straightforward and transparent, always focusing on the well-being and growth of our Rhinos.

Join our IT TEAM and bring your expertise to shape world-class digital solutions. We are seeking a motivated Backend Developer with a strong command of Python and Django to join our growing team. The ideal candidate will have at least 3 years of professional experience in backend development, with a proven record of designing and maintaining scalable backend systems.

As a Rhino, You Will

  • Design, develop, and maintain robust, scalable backend services and APIs using Python and Django.
  • Collaborate with front-end developers to integrate user-facing elements with server-side logic.
  • Optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability.
  • Implement security and data protection measures.
  • Troubleshoot, debug, and upgrade existing systems.
  • Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code.
  • Participate in code reviews to ensure high-quality standards and best practices.
  • Stay updated with emerging technologies and trends in backend development.

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field;
  • Minimum of 3 years of professional experience as a back-end developer, specifically in Python;
  • Experience with Django and Django Rest Framework (API);
  • Knowledge of Django ORM;
  • Experience with Docker;
  • Familiarity with CI/CD tools (Jenkins);
  • Solid understanding of database management systems (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB);
  • Experience designing and building RESTful APIs;
  • Familiarity with version control systems like Git;
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail;
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills;
  • Proficiency in English and Portuguese (at least B2 level);
  • Available to work remotely (based in Porto or northern Portugal).

Nice To Have

  • Knowledge of AI tools or technologies (OpenAI Service, Airflow, Mlflow);
  • Experience with React.js (Next.js);
  • Experience with file-oriented database (Delta Table - Delta Lake / Apache Iceberg);
  • Experience with unit/integration tests.

Title: Software Engineer - Python - Container Images
Description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1100+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution. The company is founder led, profitable and growing.

Canonical is building a new generation of Ubuntu-based container images to simplify open-source application deployment across the world. These container images will be free to use with long-term security commitments, and engineered for performance, security and usability. As with Ubuntu, we will work in the open and welcome community participation.

In this role, you'll be developing the tools and technology for building and maintaining this new generation of container images. You'll be working with multiple teams, both inside and outside Canonical, to ensure we deliver container images with the highest quality whilst maintaining a seamless Ubuntu user experience. You will also be highly involved in the implementation and maintenance of the Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery automation around these container images, for which you are expected to demonstrate deep insights into container-based DevOps.

You will be contributing to fast-moving products like Rocks (OCI images) and Chisel, and thus have the chance to help steer and consolidate this new team. You'll gain experience with numerous container technologies and participate in exciting and exploratory tasks, where your feedback will be critical for the decision-making process. As an engineer, your seniority will be based on your software development background and ability to lead junior team members.

Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical. This is an exciting opportunity for experienced software engineers looking for a place to leave their mark, who are passionate about shaping an open source product with the highest quality, with and for the community!


Location**: EMEA


This role entails


Build robust, scalable, leading-edge container images
Work on automated Ci/CD processes for building, testing and publishing our container images
Write tools and tests for assessing security compliance and cloud-native compatibility
Work in Python to deliver new functionalities to our container-building tools
Participate in strong engineering process through code and architectural review
Provide technical feedback for the team's decision-making process
Engage with the open-source community as a subject-matter expert
Grow our knowledge base and write documentation
Work in a collaborative, agile and globally distributed environment
Mentor and help hiring
Work from home with global travel up to 15% for internal and external events


What we are looking for in you


You are knowledgeable and passionate about software development
You are a team player and have experience in collaborative development
You have worked with CI/CD systems (e.g. Jenkins, GitHub Actions, Concourse CI, etc.)
You have a track record of delivering timely, high-quality software
You have experience with container images and containerised operations
You master at least one container management/orchestration tool (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, etc.)
You have significant experience with Python
You are experienced with Linux systems administration and package management
You have strong written and verbal communication skills to convey technical concepts
You bring clarity to technical and engineering discussions
You are someone who strongly believes that sharing is caring, and knowledge is power
Your skills range from those of a Graduate to a mid-senior Software Engineer
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or a similar degree


What we offer you

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.


Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Maternity and paternity leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.


Show more

Title: Service Now Developer
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Service Now Developer for a project based in Porto (Hybrid regime - twice a week at the office).


Responsabilities:

  • Ensure the development of new functionalities for specific projects;
  • Manage maintenance actions of the instances;
  • Manage and guarantee instance settings;
  • Keep the instances in operational condition;
  • Provide user support.


Requirements:

  • Nice to have ServiceNow experience (but training on the software is planned);
  • Nice to have Javascript knowledge;
  • Nice to have REST API knowledge;
  • Nice to have Web languages (HTML, CSS, Angular JS);
  • Good level of English - minimum B2 (mandatory)/Good level of French is a nice to have;
  • The candidate must be living in Portugal (mandatory).


If you‚Äôre interested in this job please send your CV in English.


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: QAE | Robot Framework @Porto
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: QAE with experience with Robot Framework

Seniority: +4 years

Type of position: HYBRID (at Porto)




The amazing you, will have:

4+ years of professional experience with Automated Tests, mainly using Robot Framework;
Tools for service testing: Postman, Insomnia, SoupUI, Bruno etc...
Advanced English is required;
Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines in Gitlab and Gitlab CI;
Knowledge in Continuous Integration (Pipelines and code versioning);
Experience working with DevOps;
Programming logic;
Gherkin's knowledge;
Knowledge in Xray or some Jira plugin like ‚ÄúZphyr‚Äù;
Docker(Containers);
Working with agile methodologies and practices: Scrum, Kanban, small teams, strong communication and constant interaction.







To turn yourself from amazing to unique, you¬¥ll have (plus):

Related certifications.




Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work

In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you

Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!







Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Junior Automation Programmer
Description:
We are a global digital business services organization with a mission to improve the way people and companies work. Forever. Our Consulting, Technology and Learning teams design and deliver transformational digital products and experiences that add value to our clients‚Äô businesses and to their customers‚Äô lives.




Every day, across the world, our teams are pioneering faster, better ways to bring our client‚Äôs most exciting ideas to life.




Are you passionate about innovation? Are you familiar with Mendix and Azure ecosystem? Are you eager to be part of a team shaping the future of intelligent automation? We are looking for a Junior Automation Programmer to join our team!




We want you to:

Design Mendix apps and integrate data.
Execute corrective and preventive maintenance.
Optimize performance and stay updated on vendor trends.
Support established practices and standards for the team to reach its goals.




This job might be for you if you:

1+ year of experience as a Mendix Developer.
Professional experience with cloud platforms (AWS/Azure).
Experience with object-oriented languages, such as JavaScript and Java.
Intermediate Mendix certification (not obligatory).
Understand the principles and practices required to ensure software delivery excellence and implement them to ensure quality. This includes estimates and work breakdown, risk mitigation code standards and defect root cause analysis.




What we offer:

A comprehensive health and life insurance
A flexible work environment: you can work remotely or hybrid from one of our locations
Working with the latest tools (Mac or Windows) and technologies on meaningful client engagements
Career growth opportunities and a clear progression framework
Educational programs and opportunities of training and certification at the expense of the company

Title: Sensor Software Engineer
Description:
Do you want to make a change for the better in the world?

Vestas Technology & Operations > Research & Development > Advanced Sensing & Diagnostics

The Advanced Sensing and Diagnostics Sub Module is part of the Turbine Control Software Module within Vestas Power Solutions. As such, we are responsible for delivering the software for the most complex sensor solutions, e.g. Wind Sensing, Tower Accelerations and Blade Load Sensing. Furthermore, our mission is to create smart sensor signals, which enables the turbine to run more reliable, more efficiently or enables us to detect current and potential future defects to improve our service business and thus creates value for Vestas and our customers.

For you, this is the ideal environment to apply your software engineering skills in a highly diverse team, encourage a culture of innovation to unlock customer value and ensure the highest team efficiency.

Responsibilities


Ensure project deliveries for our technical and turbine projects as part of an agile team
Be responsible to guide one or more of our key results to ensure high team efficiency and best practices
Conduct root cause analysis to pinpoint potential turbine performance issues
Contribute to defining functional and non-functional software requirements for turbine control systems
Develop innovative algorithms for smart sensing and diagnostics solutions
Participate in the refinement and advancement of processes, software, and tools


Qualifications


Master in Software Engineering, Control Engineering, Electrical Engineering or similar background
3 years experience in embedded software & data analytics environment
Experience with C++, Matlab / Simulink
Good skills within physics and data analytics, which enables you to understand turbine physics easily and analyze large sets of data efficiently


Competencies


Highly accountable and self-driven
Acts as a role model for the team
Upholds high standards of quality without compromise
Embraces change and proactively in takes improvement ideas or problems and implements their solutions
Very good communication skills for external and internal stakeholder management
Ability to effectively reach out to stakeholders within and outside the company


What We Offer

Within VSP we are one of the most cross functional departments with a huge potential to create customer Value, we are on an exciting journey of getting our processes, tools, requirements to the highest standards. You can not only be part of this, but be part of a team which mission it is to improve how the turbines function.

Additional Information

We look forward to receiving your application as soon as possible, as we will be reviewing applications on a rolling basis. To apply for this opportunity please submit your resume in English.

BEWARE ‚Äì RECRUITMENT FRAUD

It has come to our attention that there are a number of fraudulent emails from people pretending to work for Vestas. Read more via this link, https://www.vestas.com/en/careers/our-recruitment-process

DEIB Statement

At Vestas, we recognize the value of diversity, equity, and inclusion in driving innovation and success. We strongly encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply, particularly those who may hesitate due to their identity or feel they do not meet every criterion. As our CEO states, "Expertise and talent come in many forms, and a diverse workforce enhances our ability to think differently and solve the complex challenges of our industry". Your unique perspective is what will help us powering the solution for a sustainable, green energy future.

About Vestas

Vestas is the energy industry‚Äôs global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore.

Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 185 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, we have an unmatched track record demonstrating our expertise within the field.

With 30,000 employees globally, we are a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution ‚Äì today, tomorrow, and far into the future.

Vestas promotes a diverse workforce which embraces all social identities and is free of any discrimination. We commit to create and sustain an environment that acknowledges and harvests different experiences, skills, and perspectives. We also aim to give everyone equal access to opportunity.

To learn more about our company and life at Vestas, we invite you to visit our website at www.vestas.com and follow us on our social media channels. We also encourage you to join our Talent Universe to receive notifications on new and relevant postings.
